data.title: I don't get how native English speakers can understand what the woman in the video is saying
data.meta_description:
as a non-native English speaker who is studying English, I have a serious question.
Please check out a 3 sec of movie clip below.
https://youtu.be/5FOv4WWGSK8
The subtitle says "(daughter:)What
data.text:
as a non-native English speaker who is studying English, I have a serious question. Please check out a 3 sec of movie clip below.

https://youtu.be/5FOv4WWGSK8

The subtitle says "(daughter:)What about 3 00? (mom:) No, he's got a soccer game at 3 00."

But the words that a girl's mom says in the video never sounds like the same words in the subtitle.

Do native English speakers really understand this, or are they just guessing the meaning from the context?

Also, if you could tell me some tips to get the skills to improve my listening comprehensive abilities for understanding this type of English that just sounds like a mysterious incantation, that would be really appreciated. Thank you.
